DOC.brief_summary: The purpose randomized multiple-site clinical study determine whether revise CATCH-IT ( Internet-based depression prevention program ) effective general health education Internet intervention ( Health Education ) teens ages 13-18 ( inclusive ) . It hypothesize teen CATCH-IT exhibit low level depress mood and/or maintain low depressive score 2 year long-term follow compare teen Health Education group .
DOC.brief_title: Primary Care Internet Based Depression Prevention Adolescents ( CATCH-IT ) Also Known Promoting AdolescenT Health
DOC.detailed_description: Additional aim hypothesis provide : -Aim 1 : To determine whether CATCH-IT depression prevention intervention prevents delay major depressive episode , well non-affective disorder episode , compare HEALTH EDUCATION . Hypothesis 1 : Compared youth HEALTH EDUCATION condition , youth assign CATCH-IT low hazard ratio major depressive episode non-affective disorder episodes 2 year . -Aim 2 : To determine participant CATCH-IT group exhibit rapid favorable change depressive symptoms/and vulnerability/protective factor compare HEALTH EDUCATION group . Hypothesis 2 : Compared youth HEALTH EDUCATION condition , youth CATCH-IT program demonstrate steeper slope improve symptom few depressed day 2 year . -Aim 3 : To determine participant CATCH-IT program report low perceive educational impairment , great quality life , great health-related quality life , low incidence mental disorder ( anxiety , substance/alcohol use ) compare participant HEALTH EDUCATION . Hypothesis 3 : Compared youth HEALTH EDUCATION group , youth CATCH-IT program demonstrate rapid benefit reduce educational impairment , improve quality life , few disorder 2 year . -Aim 4 : To determine ( moderator ) among 13-18 year old ( inclusive ) ( mediator ) CATCH-IT program work . Hypothesis 4.1 : CATCH-IT effect moderate six domain : ( 1 ) demographic/cultural factor , ( 2 ) vulnerability factors/adverse event , ( 3 ) motivation , ( 4 ) physician relationship , ( 5 ) parent/child co-morbid psychopathology , ( 6 ) treatment . Hypothesis 4.2 : The relation CATCH-IT participation reduction depressive episode mediate adherence Internet , motivational interview fidelity alter vulnerability factor ( e.g . motivation , cognition social support ) responses adverse event , turn impact likelihood episode . Exploratory Aim 1 : To determine implementation feasibility intervention physician/nurse practitioner office nurse/medical assistant perspective well describe practice relationship medical home model . Exploratory Aim 2 : To determine whether CATCH-IT favorable cost-benefit ratio and/or cost effectiveness < $ 50,000/disability adjust life year compare HEALTH EDUCATION group .
DOC.criteria: Adolescents : ( A ) Youth age 13 18 English speaking . ( B ) Youth must experience elevate level depressive symptom Center Epidemiologic Studies Depression ( CESD ) scale ( score > /= 16 ) . ( C ) Youth include past history depression , anxiety , externalize symptom , substance abuse . Youth present partial remission major depressive episode Baseline rescreened 2 month utilize phone screen ensure episode fully remit prior randomization access study intervention . Those fully remit two month exclude . Parents : *Parent eligible adolescent Physicians ( PCP ) NP : *Physician study site Healthcare Professionals : *Primary care practice minimum 6 month Adolescents : Current DSMIV diagnosis Major Depressive Disorder Current therapy depression , take antidepressant ( e.g. , SSRIs , TCAs , MAOIs , bupropion , nefazodone , mirtazapine , venlafaxine ) ; Current CESD score > 35 ; DSMIV diagnosis schizophrenia ( current past ) bipolar affective disorder ; Current serious medical illness cause significant disability dysfunction ; Significant reading impairment ( minimum sixthgrade read level base parental report ) , mental retardation , developmental disability ; Serious imminent suicidal risk ( determine endorsement current suicide CESD KSADS interview ) condition may require immediate psychiatric hospitalization Psychotic feature disorder , currently receive psychotropic medication Extreme , current drug/alcohol abuse ( great equal 2 CRAFFT ) . Parents : Ineligible child NonEnglish speaking Physicians : *None Healthcare Professionals : *None
